to.sven.androidrccar.host.logic.impl

Class AbstractCyclicTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • to.sven.androidrccar.host.logic.impl.AbstractCyclicTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, ICyclicTask
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BatteryPowerCyclicTask, LocationCyclicTask

    public abstract class AbstractCyclicTask
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, ICyclicTask
    Abstract implementation of a cyclic task. It calls the abstract method runTask() in a given interval. A Handler is used to call the task after the given interval.
    Author:
    sven
    See Also:
    Handler#postDelayed(Runnable, long)

    • Method Detail

      • setInterval

        public void setInterval(int interval)
        Sets the interval how often the task should be called. It can set at any time. If the task ICyclicTask.isRunning() the interval is set after the next run of the task.
        Specified by:
        setInterval in interface ICyclicTask
        Parameters:
        interval - Interval in milliseconds.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Is the cyclic task running? This means that it was started through ICyclicTask.start() and was not ICyclicTask.stop() after that.
        Specified by:
        isRunning in interface ICyclicTask
        Returns:
        true, if it's running

      • start

        public void start()
        Run the task in an given interval.
        Specified by:
        start in interface ICyclicTask

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop running cyclic task. Does nothing, if its not running.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface ICyclicTask

      • run

        public void run()
        Don't call this method directly. Call start()!.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • runTask

        protected abstract void runTask()
        The task that should processed in an given interval.
